snippet: National elections will be held on Sunday, and the center-right government has lost some supporters to an anti-immigrant alternative.
abstract: Swedish Prime Min Fredrik Reinfeldt's embrace of country's tradition of openness with respect to issue of immigration has put issue at center of upcoming elections; refugees from Syria and Iraq are pouring into Sweden at a record pace, and some of supporters of central-right government are deserting it for a populist, anti-immigrant alternative.
lead_paragraph: National elections will be held on Sunday, and the center-right government has lost some supporters to an anti-immigrant alternative.

headline.main: Rift Emerges Before Vote in Sweden as Immigration Tests a Tradition of Openness
headline.print_headline: Rift Emerges Before Vote in Sweden as Immigration Tests a Tradition of Openness
